toc_entry.title: The Black Striker Gets Hit
toc_entry.description: The life—promising beginning, overripe middle, bloody end—of Lee Chagra, the biggest drug lawyer in El Paso.

toc_entry.title: Let’s Get Serious About Toys
toc_entry.description: They used to be virtuous and wooden and they were good. Now they’re commercial and plastic and they’re great.

toc_entry.title: Child’s Play
toc_entry.description: A brief but opinionated guide to the world’s best toys, from the alpha Probe to the telephone.

toc_entry.title: Texas, 1945 Or the Sad Cowboy
toc_entry.description: In a faraway archive we found the best photographs of Texas ever taken, never before published in a large group. Together, they show every part of the state as it entered the modern age. And each one has a story behind it.

toc_entry.title: The Ground’s the Limit
toc_entry.description: How a band of thrill-seekers called BASE made jumping off Texas’ tallest building the ultimate urban adventure.

toc_entry.title: Kids And Money
toc_entry.subtitle: Lifestyles
toc_entry.description: Children today understand brand names like Izod and concepts like “rip-off,” but they don’t understand that some things—the best things—can’t be bought.

toc_entry.title: Oscar’s Follies
toc_entry.subtitle: Business
toc_entry.description: Coastal Corporation’s mastermind, Oscar Wyatt, keeps everyone guessing these days—from the IRS to society columnists to stock analysts.

toc_entry.title: Rage Of Cajuns
toc_entry.subtitle: Movies
toc_entry.description: Southern Comfort bathes the bayou in blood; Chariots of Fire sets no track records; Quartet is a marvel of misdirection; True Confessions’ trespasses are forgivable; Time Bandits steals the show.

toc_entry.title: Time Of Repentance, Season Of Joy
toc_entry.subtitle: Church
toc_entry.description: On Yom Kippur, Jews in Dallas mark the Day of atonement; on Christmas Eve, Episcopalians in Houston gather for a night of adoration.

toc_entry.title: Our Son, the Murderer
toc_entry.subtitle: Theater
toc_entry.description: Dallas’s Stage #1 proves it’s worthy of its name with a gut-wrenching production about a family torn apart.

toc_entry.title: Rockers, Kickers, And Hepcats
toc_entry.subtitle: Popular Music
toc_entry.description: Texas music is wide open these days. You can stand by old standbys like Willie or take a chance on nuclear polka and Caribbean funk.

toc_entry.title: TOUTS
toc_entry.description: Have yourself a merry Texas Christmas.

toc_entry.title: Around the State
toc_entry.description: A selective guide to entertainment and events of more than usual interest.

toc_entry.title: REPORTER
toc_entry.description: Robots take over Dallas; sports talk shows take Houston by storm; border bridges take forever to get built; John Tower takes the lead in the defense debate; a Corsicana bakery takes the fruitcake.

toc_entry.title: State Secrets
toc_entry.description: Dreaming Democrats; juicy news about the News; shake-ups brewing at UT; why Reagan can’t decontrol gas.
